item.title: Six One Indie Showcase Returns Next Week With 48 Games, Including Mouse: P.I. For Hire And Hotel Barcelona
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/2025/05/15/six-one-indie-showcase-returns-next-week-with-48-games-including-mouse-pi-for-hire-and

The Six One Indie Showcase is set to return next week on May 22, and this year, it promises a lineup of 48 indie games, including world premieres, exclusive announcements, and updates to existing indies. Notable games include Mouse: P.I. For Hire, Suda51 and Swery65 team-up Hotel Barcelona, and the first look at Truth Scrapper, the next game from the developer behind In Stars and Time.

The event begins with Petey’s Play Now Pre-Show at 8:50 a.m. PT/11:50 a.m. ET, which will highlight 7 “overlooked indie games released earlier in the year,” and the main showcase begins at 9 a.m. PT/12 p.m. ET.

“Once the Showcase concludes, audiences can head to the official showcase homepage to explore over 20 hands-on previews and 40 developer interviews from the Six One Indie editorial team,” a press release reads. “Additionally, the Six One Indie Showcase Steam event will run through Monday, May 26th, featuring 150+ wishlist-worthy indies, including exclusive new demos and special event discounts.”

Six One Indie promises a deep dive into Future Vibe Check from Akupara Games and “many more reveals, demo drops, and a ‘one more thing’” from the crew to close the showcase.

item.title: Stellar Blade Hits PC Next Month, PC Specs And Features Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/2025/05/15/stellar-blade-hits-pc-next-month-pc-specs-and-features-revealed

Stellar Blade launched last year on April 26 as a PlayStation 5 exclusive, and now, developer ShiftUp is bringing the game to PC next month on June 11. ShiftUp and publisher Sony Interactive Entertainment have revealed the PC specs needed to play the action game, alongside new features. 

New content is coming to the game as part of the PC launch, but it will also be available on the PS5 version of Stellar Blade. We’ll break down the PC specs and requirements further below in the story, but let’s go over the new content coming to the game.

There is a new Royal Guard Suit for Eve, but only those who complete the new Boss Challenge will earn it. “Mann, the leader of the Sentinels, comes to test Eve,” a PlayStation Blog post reads. “He is a seasoned warrior, a master of weapons, the bodyguard of Orcal, and the guardian of Xion. Face his might in the Boss Challenge and prove why Eve is truly ‘worthy.’” 

You can view the Royal Guard Suit below:

All users will receive the new Crimson Wing suit as a token of gratitude and to celebrate the upcoming PC launch. You can check it out below:

Alongside these new suits and the boss challenge, players can now utilize Simplified Chinese voiceovers and Japanese voiceovers in all regions, and facial animations will match both languages, too. These new languages are available in the PS5 version starting today and will be available in the PC version at launch.

PC Exclusive Features

Stellar Blade on PC will support Nvidia DLSS 4 resolution scaling and frame generation, Nvidia DLAA image enhancement, and Nvidia Reflex latency reduction features. AMD FS3 will also be supported, and Stellar Blade will feature an unlocked frame rate (if you’d like). It will also support ultrawide 21:9 and super ultrawide 32:9 resolutions, with high-resolution background textures, and more.  

The PC port will also include DualSense controller support, full haptic feedback, adaptive trigger features, and full user key customization for gamepads, keyboards, and mice. 
 

PC Specs and Requirements

Stellar Blade hits PC on June 11.

While waiting for its release, check out Game Informer’s Stellar Blade review and then read about why it was our favorite action game of 2024. 

Are you going to play Stellar Blade on PC? Let us know in the comments below!
